item.title: Joy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Every poem is a momentary stay against the confusion of the world." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Joy add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Joy add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "Poetry is the opening and closing of a door, leaving those who look through to guess about what was seen during a moment." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Joy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Joy add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Joy add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Joy add a quote by Rachel Naomi Remen
item.description: "Every great loss demands that we choose life again. We need to grieve in order to do this. The pain we have not grieved over will always stand between us and life. When we don't grieve, a part of us becomes caught in the past like Lot's wife who, because she looked back, was turned into a pillar of salt." -- Rachel Naomi Remen

item.title: Joy add a quote by Rachel Naomi Remen
item.description: "Life offers its wisdom generously. Everything teaches. Not everyone learns." -- Rachel Naomi Remen

item.title: Joy add a quote by Rachel Naomi Remen
item.description: "If you carry someone else's fears and live by someone else's values, you may find that you have lived their lives." -- Rachel Naomi Remen

item.title: Joy add a quote by Rachel Naomi Remen
item.description: "There are only two kinds of people in the world. Those who are alive and those who are afraid" -- Rachel Naomi Remen

item.title: Joy add a quote by Rachel Naomi Remen
item.description: "It is not that we have a soul, but that we are a soul." -- Rachel Naomi Remen

item.title: Joy add a quote by Rachel Naomi Remen
item.description: "From a good teacher you may learn the secret of listening. You will never learn the secret of life. You will have to listen for yourself" -- Rachel Naomi Remen

item.title: Joy add a quote by Henry Adams
item.description: "A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops." -- Henry Adams

item.title: Joy add a quote by Auden
item.description: "Love each other or perish" -- Auden

item.title: Joy add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Without love we all like birds with broken wings." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Joy add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "There is a big confusion in this country over what we want verses what we need...you need food. You want a chocolate sundae." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Joy add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Joy add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Joy add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "Be joyful because it is humanly possible." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Joy add a quote by Fanny Fern
item.description: "There are no little things. Little things are the hinges of the universe." -- Fanny Fern

item.title: Joy add a quote by Susanne K. Langer
item.description: "Most new discoveries are suddenly seen things that were always there." -- Susanne K. Langer

item.title: Joy add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description: "Sorrow fully accepted brings its own gifts. For there is alchemy in sorrow. It can be transmitted into wisdom, which, if it does not bring joy, can yet bring happiness." -- Pearl S. Buck

item.title: Joy add a quote by Liang Li
item.description: "The wheel outside the door is just the moon. The objects hanging from the eaves, just the autumn clouds" -- Liang Li

item.title: Joy add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "To hold a pen is to be at war." -- Voltaire

item.title: Joy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Forgiveness is giving up all hope of having had a better past." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Joy add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "When you sell a man a book you don't sell just twelve ounces of paper and ink and glue - you sell him a whole new life. Love and friendship and humour and ships at sea by night - there's all heaven and earth in a book, a real book." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Joy add a quote by Grace Murray Hopper
item.description: "A ship in port is safe, but that's not what ships are built for." -- Grace Murray Hopper

item.title: Joy add a quote by Jack Kornfield
item.description: "To bow to the fact of our life's sorrows and betrayals is to accept them; and from this deep gesture we discover that all life is workable. As we learn to bow, we discover that the heart holds more freedom and compassion than we could imagine." -- Jack Kornfield

item.title: Joy add a quote by Julian of Norwich
item.description: "If there is anywhere on earth a lover of God who is always kept safe, I know nothing of it, for it was not shown to me. But this was shown: that in falling and rising again we are always kept in that same precious love." -- Julian of Norwich

item.title: Joy add a quote by Mark Salzman
item.description: "suffering borne by two is nearly joy." -- Mark Salzman
